definition: to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
(of fire, lamp etc) to go out/to put out (fire)/(fig.) to die down/(of a vehicle) to stall
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished

sentences.english: In the middle of the bridge,his old car spluttered out.
sentences.chinese: 在过桥走到桥中间时，他的那辆破车劈啪响着熄了火。

sentences.english: Yet can not stop the fire of love from me to you.
sentences.chinese: 也浇不熄我对你爱情的火焰。

sentences.english: He would constantly keep the lamp trimmed and burning before her shrine in his heart.
sentences.chinese: 他会在心里经常修剪她圣所前的圣灯并让它长明不熄。

sentences.english: He stubbed out the cigarette on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他在地板上踩熄了他的香烟。

sentences.english: The wind of change that fans the flame.
sentences.chinese: 这宣示改变的风，让心中火焰永远不熄。

sentences.english: Knock the eternal alive the spark of love.
sentences.chinese: 撞出永久不熄的爱的火花。

sentences.english: The fire is dying down. Please get more coal.
sentences.chinese: 火快要熄了，请再弄些煤来。

sentences.english: The elevator stopped suddenly between floors, and the lights went out.
sentences.chinese: 电梯在两层楼的中间突然停下来，电灯也熄了。

sentences.english: When the sixth had struck, he snuffed the candle with his fingers.
sentences.chinese: 第六响敲过以后，他用手指掐熄了烛芯。

sentences.english: When the light is off, or black, the layer can’t be seen.
sentences.chinese: 当在灯熄或黑夜下，图像时不能被看见的。

sentences.english: Love is the creative fire, the inspiration that keeps the torch of progress aflame .
sentences.chinese: 爱是创造之火，是使提高的火把燃烧不熄的灵感。

sentences.english: Love is the creative fire, the inspiration that keeps the torch of progress aflame.
sentences.chinese: 爱是创造之火，是使进步的火炬燃烧不熄的灵感。

sentences.english: Someone mutters, and a street lamp gutters, and soon it will be morning.
sentences.chinese: 有人喃喃低语，一盏街灯将熄，清晨就快要来临。

sentences.english: He turns off the car and follows Teri.
sentences.chinese: 他把车熄了火，下车追寻泰瑞。

sentences.english: I shaded it with my cloak to save it from the wind， that is why the lamp went out.
sentences.chinese: 我用斗篷遮住它怕它被风吹灭，因此灯熄了。

definition: to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
fire and candles/household things that burn
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
